Name: Mirror
Description: The round mirror face is fixed to its handle with a tang. The handle is also cast from bronze and is shaped like a papyrus pillar with the wide crown fanning out above the double Hathor head. Among other things, Hathor with cow's ears is a goddess associated with beauty and thus also with cosmetics, and the papyrus is a symbol of wellbeing. This mirror formed part of the funerary equipment. It was wrapped in bandages and lay next to the hand of the deceased.
